body: Yeah this one would be nice.

Yeah, but it's not that easy though, because if you deleted the file, and no other node has it, it could never go back to 100% in sync, so you cannot just not send deletes, you'd have to send deletes, but say ignore this discrepancy.
Though this is a duplicate of #62 as was #584

By itself, this kind of makes sense. But after a while, you end up in the situation where

PC has
- FileA
- FileB
- ~~FileC~~ deleted
- ~~FileD~~ deleted

Phone has
- ~~FileA~~ deleted
- ~~FileB~~ deleted
- FileC
- FileD

100% in sync! But nothing is the same. I'm confused. :( And what happens when a file that has been deleted on the PC is updated on the phone? Does the update override the delete? Or the file stays deleted...?

Hm I thought the use-case is clear, I simply want to have all pictures from my phone to my pc. But if I clean up the folder on my phone I dont want that the fotos are also deleted on my pc. Also if I delete e.g. some unneeded thumbnail-folders on my pc I dont want my pc to delete them on the mobile phone.

The option "Folder Master" is already given, so I can easily delete the thumbnail folder but if I at the moment clean up the camera-folder on my mobile phone, the files get also deleted on my pc which is what I dont want. So to do this, for me its as easy as do not push the delete to the pc. The phone is simply doing as it have never had the file. For the phone it is the same as if I delete a file on the pc and then copy it back on the pc (but because of the "Folder Master"-option it is not synced back to the phone).

And for the file that is updated on the phone: I dont know, how is it handled at the moment? This does not depend on the new feature, or? So this situation is also possible with the "Folder Master" option enabled...!?

Ah and btw sorry for the duplicate.. Have not seen the other ones..

No, it's more complicated than the folder master option, because this prevents sync in both directions. It's "easy" to just sync one way. It's more difficult to not sync both ways. :) The way sync works currently is that each file has a version number that increases. For example version=5 can contain some data, version=6 can be the deleted version. If a machine has version 5, it knows it should go up to version 6 and delete the file. But if we ignore the delete, and then create a new file in the same place - is that a new file, newer than the delete we ignored? If we ignore version 6 (the delete) and keep version 5, but there is then a version 7 with other content, should we sync to that? What if we manually deleted the file after ignoring the delete...?

Point being, it's tricky. :) At this point, too tricky for this special case I think. If you or someone else wants to iron out all the details though, I won't be against it.

(I don't think is an exact duplicate of #62 though, that's something slightly different.)
To be honest, you can already achieve a similar behaviour with versioning enabled, as at the point you delete a file it gets archived preserving a copy.

Dont think too complicate, if the feature is implemented as I mean, the behaviour is exactly the same as if I am doing the following:
- Set camera-folder on the phone to "Folder Master"
- Let camera sync files to the pc
- Set pc to versioning (keep 1 last file)
- Delete pictures from the phone
- Copy pictures from version folder back to the main-folder on the pc (remember they get not synced back to the phone because on the phone "Folder Master" is active)

In this scenario we do have the same "tricky" problems, but for Camera-Upload of the phone to the pc it would be a very nice feature and you never will have any problems with updated files as usually the phone takes a picture with date-string in its name which is never modified..

I know the lamport clock thing with numbers for file-versions but I do not see the problem, following  my previous example:
- New picture X on phone detected (gets version 1)
- Picture X is uploaded to pc (pc now also have version 1 of the file)
- Picture X is deleted on phone (with activated "Do not push file delete", so it gets no new version-number it is simply forgotton by the phone)
- Phone does as it has never had the file
- Pc says I have version 1 of picture X
- Phone says I am "Folder Master" I dont want to have Picture X version 1 because I did not initially created it

issue.title: Optionally ignore remote deletes

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New features or improvements of some kind, as opposed to a problem (bug)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body: This seemed like a fairly simple addition. If configured to ignore deletes, just drop incoming index updates with that bit set. There ought to have been an enhancement ticket for this behavior somewhere, but I can't find it.

body: Will this option let me truncate files? (and have the truncation propagated)
@jpjp Sure. That's a modification from our POV, not a delete.
Not the options in web interface. Only config files.

issue.title: Update to latest Syncthing release
issue.body:
Upstream has now things like [Optionally ignore remote deletes](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/issues/1254) which is particularly useful for removing photos/videos from a phone after having them synced.

It would be great to have that feature in the Android version.

body: I just installed this on my phone and computer, but there are no options for ignoring deletes in any of the menus. This is pretty vital, considering my use case is syncing photos from my phone to computer, and when I clear photos on the phone, I don't want them to be removed from the computer.
It's in the advanced config available over web ui
I tried that on android, using the web-gui too, and there was no option for that.

Look harder :wink:

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/568104/12210657/7ec9b32c-b653-11e5-9c6e-17f799a7b0a5.PNG)

Where are you seeing that?

Here is the webgui for android:

![pic1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/930215/12217090/70cc9346-b6c3-11e5-854a-48739296fc2f.png)

No option to ignore deletes.
Also, just checked on my mac, v12.11, and I can't find any of those options in the folder menu.
Actions -> Advanced -> Folder XYZ -> ignoreDelete

Oh jesus, thanks. That was weird. You'd think that within the folder menu itself would be an expandable advanced menu. IMO ignore deletes is such a fundamental use case for so many of us syncing photos and such, that it should be built into the main part of the folder menu itself.
We don't think so.
Syncing photos and being able to delete them from my phone is pretty much my only use case for syncthing.
It's not handled well enough to be in the main set of settings yet, as you will see that enabling this option will cause devices to show up out of sync, which as a result causes confusion.
